intro: Pavetta manillensis, commonly known as the Manila pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds.
